exceptions

Class CorruptedSequenceException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • exceptions.CorruptedSequenceException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CorruptedSequenceException
extends java.lang.Exception
    An instance of this class is thrown if a char, which is not one of 'A', 'T', 'C' or 'G', is detected in a sequence.
    Author:
    Ben Kohr
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int index
      The index of the observed wrong character
      java.lang.String nucleotides
      The nucleotide list.
      char problem
      The problematic character.
      AnalysedSequence sequence
      If available, the corrupt sequence is referenced.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CorruptedSequenceException()
      This Constructor specifies the position, the type of wrong character in an observed sequence object and the object itself.
      CorruptedSequenceException(int i, char problem, java.lang.String nucleotides)
      Constructor specifies the position, the type of wrong character in an observed sequence and the nucleotide String.

        public java.lang.String nucleotides
        The nucleotide list.

      • problem

        public char problem
        The problematic character.

      • sequence

        public AnalysedSequence sequence
        If available, the corrupt sequence is referenced. If only a nucleotide String is given, this will be a null reference.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CorruptedSequenceException

        public CorruptedSequenceException()

        Constructor specifies the position, the type of wrong character in an observed sequence and the nucleotide String.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the wrong character
        problem - The wrong character
        nucleotides - The nucleotide String which is corrupted
